meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a brogue
meanings.sent1: The broguish shoes he wore had a distinct Scottish flair.
meanings.sent2: Her broguish accent reminded me of the rolling hills of Ireland.
meanings.sent3: The broguish hat he wore made him look like a character from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: His broguish attire transported me to a quaint village in the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The broguish design of the room gave it a cozy and rustic feel.

meanings.definition: Playfully mischievous or teasing in a good-natured way
meanings.sent1: She gave him a broguish smile before pulling a harmless prank on him.
meanings.sent2: The children's broguish laughter filled the room as they played together.
meanings.sent3: His broguish sense of humor always lightened the mood during meetings.
meanings.sent4: The cat's broguish antics kept the family entertained all evening.
meanings.sent5: Her broguish wink hinted at the playful surprise she had in store.
